messages.content: What is the course code and title for this class?
The course code is MCS*2020 and the title is 'Information Management.'
What department is this course under?
This course is under the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.
What is the credit weight of this course?
The credit weight of this course is 0.50 credits.
Is this course available in an online format?
Yes, this course is available as a distance education (online) course.
What are some of the topics covered in this course?
Topics include the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
How many units are there in this course?
There are 12 units in this course.
What are the prerequisites for this course?

4.00 credits - Must be completed prior to taking this course. This is a Priority Access Course. Some restrictions may apply during some time periods. Please contact the department for more information. Not available to students registered in BCOMP program.
What should I do if I have questions about course restrictions?
You should check with your advisor for any course restrictions.
What's covered in the first week of class?
In the first week, you'll review the syllabus, assessments, and introduction video on Courselink.
What is the course description?
This course introduces the concepts and principles of information acquisition, manipulation, and management as relevant to organizational decision-making.
What are the main learning outcomes?
Students will discuss trends impacting organizations, explain effective information management for competitive advantage, and evaluate information sources for decision-making.
When does the class meet?
Classes are conducted online via Courselink, and it's important to check frequently for updates.
